repeated signal-averaging.By making standards with known concentrations, we determined that the detection limit for possible products of interest (such as methanol and formic acid) is 0.5 mgL (corresponding to 40 g of products in the volume of solution used in our experiments).This compares with 120 g of gas-phase CO observed.Based on the solutionphase detection limit, we conclude that CO must be 75 of the total reaction product, although we cannot rule out smaller amounts of other products.
